titles.title: A bill to authorize funding for the National Crime Victim Law Institute to provide support for victims of crime under Crime Victims Legal Assistance Programs as a part of the Victims of Crime Act of 1984.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Mr. Conyers moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3641.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 410 - 2 (Roll no. 676).

action.text: Mr. Cannon moved to reconsider the vote.
Mr. Hastings (FL) moved to table the motion to reconsider the vote
On motion to table the motion to reconsider the vote Agreed to by recorded vote: 295 - 115 (Roll no. 677).
Motion to reconsider the vote tabled.

bill.summary:
10/15/2008--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Amends the Justice for All Act of 2004 to extend through FY2013 funding for the grant program to provide legal assistance to victims of crime.
